creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Dr and Mrs Robert Feinberg
markings: L center, square relief stamp; L center, square relief stamp
medium: ink on paper sized with mica
text: Kimura Kenkadō was an influential figure in the literati painting circles in and around Osaka. He was not only known to be an admirer of the arts, but also hosted art gatherings and offered painters a place to share and exhibit their works.
title: Landscape
